issue.title: Move colorlib into a separate independent package

milestone.title: v1.8.0
milestone.description: Focus will likely be on making separate installable packages for some subcomponents.

comment.body:
Hi!
Please, is this going to happen?
I'm the author of the https://github.com/rsalmei/alive-progress lib, and I'm looking for some cool terminal color lib to use. If this was split I could consider using it.
Thanks.

issue.title: bug: Importing `colors` from `plumbum` adds a trailing line to the output
issue.body:
It seems like merely importing `colors` from `plumbum` while setting `FORCE_COLOR` to supported values 1, 2, 3 and 4 adds a new line to a Python script output. Any other value (0, 5, 6, -1, "", "hello") do not trigger this behavior.

```bash
cd $(mktemp -d)
python -m venv .venv
. .venv/bin/activate
pip install plumbum rich

cat <<EOF >colors_without_plumbum.py
from rich.console import Console
console = Console()
console.print("[bold green]Hello[/]")
EOF

cat <<EOF >colors_with_plumbum.py
from plumbum import colors
from rich.console import Console
console = Console()
console.print("[bold green]Hello[/]")
EOF

cat <<EOF >colors.sh
echo "NOT forcing colors without Plumbum import"
python colors_without_plumbum.py | cat -n
echo "NOT forcing colors with Plumbum import"
python colors_with_plumbum.py | cat -n
echo "Forcing colors without Plumbum imports"
FORCE_COLOR=1 python colors_without_plumbum.py | cat -n
echo "Forcing colors with Plumbum imports"
FORCE_COLOR=1 python colors_with_plumbum.py | cat -n
EOF

bash colors.sh
```

![plumbum](https://github.com/tomerfiliba/plumbum/assets/3999221/7b1bb206-7b5f-4609-900d-5b73c0e5823d)

The `%` comes from my Zsh prompt. If we redirect the output to a file and open it, here are the contents:

```
[1;32mHello[0m
[0m
```

Without the Plmbum import, contents are:

```
[1;32mHello[0m
```

- System: Linux
- Python: 3.11.5
- Plumbum: 1.8.2
- Rich: 13.6.0

comment.body: Hmmm, I'd say this is caused by `atexit.register(_reset)` in `plumbum.colors`.

comment.body:
The output of this script is weird too :thinking: 

```bash
for value in -1 0 1 2 3 4 5 "" yes no; do
    echo "FORCE_COLOR=${value}"
    FORCE_COLOR="${value}" python colors_with_plumbum.py | cat -n
done
```

![plumbum2](https://github.com/tomerfiliba/plumbum/assets/3999221/b786b145-5e23-4258-b61a-68223cf91000)

It looks like the offending values 1, 2, 3 and 4 add not-only a new line but also indentation?

issue.title: Type hints for library
issue.body: Please add type hints for your awesome library, so it can use with mypy checking. [Here is some info on how to do this mainly painlessly](http://mypy.readthedocs.io/en/latest/basics.html#library-stubs)

comment.body: Cool library! Bummer there are no types.

pull_request.title: Update index.rst - fix broken link for sh project

commits.message: bug fix for picking ProcessExecutionError with stdout/stderr buffers

lock setuptools-scm to avoid compatibility issue

https://github.com/pypa/setuptools_scm/issues/905

Revert "lock setuptools-scm to avoid compatibility issue"

This reverts commit 0147fdb6202ef51ffbd540f47b5ba247e8a3ec5f.
A fix was introduced in setuptools-scm 8.0.1 that fixed the issue

issue.title: plumbum doesnt support symbol Tilde
issue.body:
When I use the tilde, plumbum prompts an error


```
>>> local.cwd.chdir('~/')
Traceback (most recent call last):
  File "<stdin>", line 1, in <module>
  File "/usr/local/lib/python3.10/site-packages/plumbum/path/local.py", line 332, in chdir
    os.chdir(str(newdir))
FileNotFoundError: [Errno 2] No such file or directory: '~/'
```
